pppRowStatusTable.name: pppRowStatusTable
pppRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of ppp components.

pppRowStatusEntry.name: pppRowStatusEntry
pppRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single ppp component.

pppRowStatus.name: pppRowStatus
pppRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of ppp components. These components can be added and deleted.

pppComponentName.name: pppComponentName
pppComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

pppStorageType.name: pppStorageType
pppStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the ppp tables.

pppIndex.name: pppIndex
pppIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the ppp tables.

pppCidDataTable.name: pppCidDataTable
pppCidDataTable.description: This group contains the attribute for a component's Customer Identifier (CID). Refer to the attribute description for a detailed explanation of CIDs.

pppCustomerIdentifier.name: pppCustomerIdentifier
pppCustomerIdentifier.description: This attribute holds the Customer Identifier (CID). Every component has a CID. If a component has a cid attribute, the component's CID is the provisioned value of that attribute; otherwise the component inherits the CID of its parent. The top- level component has a CID of 0. Every operator session also has a CID, which is the CID provisioned for the operator's user ID. An operator will see only the stream data for components having a matching CID. Also, the operator will be allowed to issue commands for only those components which have a matching CID. An operator CID of 0 is used to identify the Network Manager (referred to as 'NetMan' in DPN). This CID matches the CID of any component. Values 1 to 8191 inclusive (equivalent to 'basic CIDs' in DPN) may be assigned to specific customers.

pppIfEntryTable.name: pppIfEntryTable
pppIfEntryTable.description: This group contains the provisionable attributes for the ifEntry.

pppIfAdminStatus.name: pppIfAdminStatus
pppIfAdminStatus.description: The desired state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational. The down state indicates the interface is not operational. The testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

pppIfIndex.name: pppIfIndex
pppIfIndex.description: This is the index for the IfEntry. Its value is automatically initialized during the provisioning process.

pppMpTable.name: pppMpTable
pppMpTable.description: This group contains the base provisioning data for the Media Application component.

pppLinkToProtocolPort.name: pppLinkToProtocolPort
pppLinkToProtocolPort.description: This attribute contains a protocol port component name. The attribute associates the application with a protocol port.

pppStateTable.name: pppStateTable
pppStateTable.description: This group contains the three OSI State attributes. The descriptions generically indicate what each state attribute implies about the component. Note that not all the values and state combinations described here are supported by every component which uses this group. For component-specific information and the valid state combinations, refer to NTP 241-7001-150, Passport Operations and Maintenance Guide.

pppAdminState.name: pppAdminState
pppAdminState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Administrative State of the component. The value locked indicates that the component is administratively prohibited from providing services for its users. A Lock or Lock - force command has been previously issued for this component. When the value is locked, the value of usageState must be idle. The value shuttingDown indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide service to its existing users only. A Lock command was issued against the component and it is in the process of shutting down. The value unlocked indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide services for its users. To enter this state, issue an Unlock command to this component.

pppOperationalState.name: pppOperationalState
pppOperationalState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Operational State of the component. The value enabled indicates that the component is available for operation. Note that if adminState is locked, it would still not be providing service. The value disabled indicates that the component is not available for operation. For example, something is wrong with the component itself, or with another component on which this one depends. If the value is disabled, the usageState must be idle.

pppUsageState.name: pppUsageState
pppUsageState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Usage State of the component. The value idle indicates that the component is not currently in use. The value active indicates that the component is in use and has spare capacity to provide for additional users. The value busy indicates that the component is in use and has no spare operating capacity for additional users at this time.

pppOperStatusTable.name: pppOperStatusTable
pppOperStatusTable.description: This group includes the Operational Status attribute. This attribute defines the current operational state of this component.

pppSnmpOperStatus.name: pppSnmpOperStatus
pppSnmpOperStatus.description: The current state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational and capable of forwarding packets. The down state indicates the interface is not operational, thus unable to forward packets. testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

pppLnkRowStatusTable.name: pppLnkRowStatusTable
pppLnkRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of pppLnk components.

pppLnkRowStatusEntry.name: pppLnkRowStatusEntry
pppLnkRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single pppLnk component.

pppLnkRowStatus.name: pppLnkRowStatus
pppLnkRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of pppLnk components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

pppLnkComponentName.name: pppLnkComponentName
pppLnkComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

pppLnkStorageType.name: pppLnkStorageType
pppLnkStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the pppLnk tables.

pppLnkIndex.name: pppLnkIndex
pppLnkIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the pppLnk tables.

pppLnkProvTable.name: pppLnkProvTable
pppLnkProvTable.description: This group contains the provisioned attributes for the Ppp Link component.

pppLnkConfigInitialMru.name: pppLnkConfigInitialMru
pppLnkConfigInitialMru.description: This is the initial Maximum Receive Unit (Mru) that the local Ppp entity will advertise to the remote entity. A change to this attribute will not take effect until Ppp is restarted (lock/unlock).

pppLnkConfigMagicNumber.name: pppLnkConfigMagicNumber
pppLnkConfigMagicNumber.description: If enabled then the local node will attempt to perform Magic Number negotiation with the remote node. If disabled then this negotiation is not performed. In any event, the local node will comply with any magic number negotiations attempted by the remote node, per the Ppp specification. A change to this attribute will not take effect until Ppp is restarted (lock/unlock).

pppLnkRestartTimer.name: pppLnkRestartTimer
pppLnkRestartTimer.description: This is the time, in milliseconds, that Ppp will wait for a response to a configure request or a terminate request before retrying.

pppLnkContinuityMonitor.name: pppLnkContinuityMonitor
pppLnkContinuityMonitor.description: This attribute turns on/off (enabled/disabled) the Link Continuity Monitor. If set to enabled, periodic keep alive echo packet will be sent over the Ppp link. If set to disabled, no keep alive packets will be sent. A change to this attribute will not take effect until Ppp is restarted (lock/ unlock).

pppLnkNegativeAckTries.name: pppLnkNegativeAckTries
pppLnkNegativeAckTries.description: This attribute specifies the maximum negative acknowledgments sent to the remote Ppp entity during negotiation before defaulting it's configuration parameters.

pppLnkQualityThreshold.name: pppLnkQualityThreshold
pppLnkQualityThreshold.description: This attribute specifies the minimum allowed line quality before the line is considered too poor to continue operation. The value for this attribute is a percentage measure of the line quality given in integers (10 to 99). The higher the value, the more stringent the line requirements.

pppLnkQualityWindow.name: pppLnkQualityWindow
pppLnkQualityWindow.description: This attribute specifies the number of seconds used for sampling line quality. If line quality drops below the level set with the qualityThreshold attribute during this window, this instance of Ppp will be marked down until line quality recovers.

pppLnkTerminateRequestTries.name: pppLnkTerminateRequestTries
pppLnkTerminateRequestTries.description: This attribute specifies the maximum terminate requests to be sent, when closing the connection, and not answered before this instance of Ppp enters a closing state.

pppLnkConfigureRequestTries.name: pppLnkConfigureRequestTries
pppLnkConfigureRequestTries.description: This attribute specifies the number of configuration requests that will be sent out and not answered before this instance of Ppp enters a listening state. If both sides enter the listening state then the link will not come up. To eliminate this possibility, this attribute should be set to 1000000000. This will ensure that this end of the Ppp link will continue to try until the link is good.

pppLnkOperTable.name: pppLnkOperTable
pppLnkOperTable.description: This group contains the Ppp Link Operational attributes.

pppLnkOperState.name: pppLnkOperState
pppLnkOperState.description: This is the operational state of the Link Control Protocol. For more information as to the definition of each state see RFC1331 section 5.3.

pppLnkLineCondition.name: pppLnkLineCondition
pppLnkLineCondition.description: This attribute describes the condition of the physical line that Ppp is running over. ok: The condition of the line is good. looped: The line is looped back on itself, probably at the remote end. noClock: There is a hardware problem with the line. The cable may not be plugged in correctly. badLineCondition: The quality of the line is below the qualityThreshold.

pppLnkBadAddresses.name: pppLnkBadAddresses
pppLnkBadAddresses.description: This attribute counts the number of packets received with an incorrect Address Field. If this count is going up quickly, it could indicate that there is a line quality problem or that the remote end is transmitting a protocol other than Ppp. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

pppLnkBadControls.name: pppLnkBadControls
pppLnkBadControls.description: This attribute counts the number of packets received on this link with an incorrect Control Field. If this count is going up quickly, it could indicate that there is a line quality problem or that the remote end is transmitting a protocol other than Ppp. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

pppLnkPacketTooLongs.name: pppLnkPacketTooLongs
pppLnkPacketTooLongs.description: This attribute counts the number of packets received that have been discarded because their length exceeded the Maximum Receive Unit (Mru). This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

pppLnkBadFcss.name: pppLnkBadFcss
pppLnkBadFcss.description: This attribute counts the number of packets received that have been discarded due to having an incorrect Frame Check Sequence (Fcs). This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

pppLnkLocalMru.name: pppLnkLocalMru
pppLnkLocalMru.description: This is the current value of the Maximum Receive Unit (Mru) for the local Ppp Entity. This value is the Mru that the remote entity is using when sending packets to the local Ppp entity.

pppLnkRemoteMru.name: pppLnkRemoteMru
pppLnkRemoteMru.description: This is the current value of the Maximum Receive Unit (Mru) for the remote Ppp entity. This value is the Mru that the local entity is using when sending packets to the remote Ppp entity.

pppLnkTransmitFcsSize.name: pppLnkTransmitFcsSize
pppLnkTransmitFcsSize.description: This is the size of the Frame Check Sequence (Fcs) in bits that the local node will generate when sending packets to the remote node.

pppLnkReceiveFcsSize.name: pppLnkReceiveFcsSize
pppLnkReceiveFcsSize.description: This is the size of the Frame Check Sequence (Fcs) in bits that the remote node will generate when sending packets to the local node.

pppLqmRowStatusTable.name: pppLqmRowStatusTable
pppLqmRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of pppLqm components.

pppLqmRowStatusEntry.name: pppLqmRowStatusEntry
pppLqmRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single pppLqm component.

pppLqmRowStatus.name: pppLqmRowStatus
pppLqmRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of pppLqm components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

pppLqmComponentName.name: pppLqmComponentName
pppLqmComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

pppLqmStorageType.name: pppLqmStorageType
pppLqmStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the pppLqm tables.

pppLqmIndex.name: pppLqmIndex
pppLqmIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the pppLqm tables.

pppLqmProvTable.name: pppLqmProvTable
pppLqmProvTable.description: This group contains the provisioned attributes for the Ppp Link Quality Monitor component.

pppLqmConfigPeriod.name: pppLqmConfigPeriod
pppLqmConfigPeriod.description: This is the Lqm reporting period that the local Ppp entity will attempt to negotiate with the remote entity, in units of hundredths of a second. A value of '0' will allow the remote Ppp entity to determine the reporting period. A value greater than 180,000 (1/2 hour) will allow the period to be determined dynamically as a function of the transmit data rate. A value from 1-9 will be rounded up to 10 during negotiation. A change to this attribute will not take effect until Ppp is restarted (lock/unlock).

pppLqmConfigStatus.name: pppLqmConfigStatus
pppLqmConfigStatus.description: If this attribute is enabled, the local node will attempt to perform Lqm negotiation with the remote node. If it is disabled then this negotiation is not performed. A change to this attribute will not take effect until Ppp is restarted (lock/unlock).

pppLqmOperTable.name: pppLqmOperTable
pppLqmOperTable.description: This group contains the operational attributes for the Ppp Link Quality Monitor component.

pppLqmQuality.name: pppLqmQuality
pppLqmQuality.description: This is the current quality of the link as declared by the local Ppp entity's Link-Quality Management modules. A value of good indicates that LinkQualityMonitor configStatus is enabled and Link quality is above Link qualityThreshold. A value of bad indicates that LinkQualityMonitor configStatus is enabled and Link quality is not above Link qualityThreshold. A value of notDetermined indicates that LinkQualityMonitor configStatus is enabled and the quality of the link has not been calculated yet or LinkQualityMonitor configStatus is disabled.

pppLqmInGoodOctets.name: pppLqmInGoodOctets
pppLqmInGoodOctets.description: This attribute counts the number of good octets received. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

pppLqmLocalPeriod.name: pppLqmLocalPeriod
pppLqmLocalPeriod.description: This is the Lqm reporting period, in hundredths of a second that is in effect for the local Ppp entity.

pppLqmRemotePeriod.name: pppLqmRemotePeriod
pppLqmRemotePeriod.description: This is the Lqm reporting period, in hundredths of a second, that is in effect for the remote Ppp entity.

pppLqmOutLqrs.name: pppLqmOutLqrs
pppLqmOutLqrs.description: This attribute counts the number of link quality reports sent out. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

pppLqmInLqrs.name: pppLqmInLqrs
pppLqmInLqrs.description: This attribute counts the number of link quality reports received. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

pppNcpRowStatusTable.name: pppNcpRowStatusTable
pppNcpRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of pppNcp components.

pppNcpRowStatusEntry.name: pppNcpRowStatusEntry
pppNcpRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single pppNcp component.

pppNcpRowStatus.name: pppNcpRowStatus
pppNcpRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of pppNcp components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

pppNcpComponentName.name: pppNcpComponentName
pppNcpComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

pppNcpStorageType.name: pppNcpStorageType
pppNcpStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the pppNcp tables.

pppNcpIndex.name: pppNcpIndex
pppNcpIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the pppNcp tables.

pppNcpBprovTable.name: pppNcpBprovTable
pppNcpBprovTable.description: This group contains the provisioned attributes for the Bridge Network Control Protocol.

pppNcpBConfigTinygram.name: pppNcpBConfigTinygram
pppNcpBConfigTinygram.description: If this attribute is set to disabled then the local Bridge Network Control Protocol (Bncp) entity will not initiate the tinygram compression option negotiation. If it is enabled then the local Bncp entity will initiate negotiation of this option. A change to this attribute will not take effect until Ppp is restarted (lock/unlock).

pppNcpBConfigLanId.name: pppNcpBConfigLanId
pppNcpBConfigLanId.description: If this attribute is set to disabled then the local Bncp entity will not initiate the lan identification option negotiation. If it is enabled then the local Bncp entity will initiate negotiation of the option. A change to this attribute will not take effect until Ppp is restarted (lock/unlock).

pppNcpIpOperTable.name: pppNcpIpOperTable
pppNcpIpOperTable.description: This group contains the Ip Network Control Protocol operational attributes.

pppNcpIpOperState.name: pppNcpIpOperState
pppNcpIpOperState.description: This is the operational state of the Ip network protocol. For more information as to the definition of each state see RFC1331 section 5.3.

pppNcpBoperTable.name: pppNcpBoperTable
pppNcpBoperTable.description: This group contains the Bridge Network Control Protocol operational attributes.

pppNcpBOperState.name: pppNcpBOperState
pppNcpBOperState.description: This is the operational status of the bridge network protocol. For more information as to the definition of each state see RFC1331 section 5.3.

pppNcpBLocalToRemoteTinygramComp.name: pppNcpBLocalToRemoteTinygramComp
pppNcpBLocalToRemoteTinygramComp.description: This attribute indicates whether the local node will perform tinygram compression when sending packets to the remote entity. If it is disabled then the local entity will not perform tinygram compression. If it is enabled then the local entity will perform tinygram compression.

pppNcpBRemoteToLocalTinygramComp.name: pppNcpBRemoteToLocalTinygramComp
pppNcpBRemoteToLocalTinygramComp.description: If this attribute is disabled then the remote entity is not expected to perform tinygram compression. If it is enabled then the remote entity is expected to perform tinygram compression.

pppNcpBLocalToRemoteLanId.name: pppNcpBLocalToRemoteLanId
pppNcpBLocalToRemoteLanId.description: This attribute indicates whether the local node will include the lan identification field in transmitted packets or not. If it is disabled then the local node will not transmit this field, enabled means that the field will be transmitted.

pppNcpBRemoteToLocalLanId.name: pppNcpBRemoteToLocalLanId
pppNcpBRemoteToLocalLanId.description: This attribute indicates whether the remote node has indicated that it will include the lan identification field in transmitted packets or not. If it is disabled then the field will not be transmitted, if enabled then the field will be transmitted.

pppNcpOperTable.name: pppNcpOperTable
pppNcpOperTable.description: This group contains the operational attributes for any Network Control Protocols other than Ip and Bridge.

pppNcpAppletalkOperState.name: pppNcpAppletalkOperState
pppNcpAppletalkOperState.description: This is the operational state of the AppleTalk network protocol. For more information as to the definition of each state see RFC1331 section 5.3.

pppNcpIpxOperState.name: pppNcpIpxOperState
pppNcpIpxOperState.description: This is the operational state of the Ipx network protocol. For more information as to the definition of each state see RFC1331 section 5.3.

pppNcpXnsOperState.name: pppNcpXnsOperState
pppNcpXnsOperState.description: This is the operational state of the Xns network protocol. For more information as to the definition of each state see RFC1331 section 5.3.

pppNcpDecnetOperState.name: pppNcpDecnetOperState
pppNcpDecnetOperState.description: This is the operational state of the DecNet network protocol. For more information as to the definition of each state see RFC1331 section 5.3.

pppNcpBmcEntryRowStatusTable.name: pppNcpBmcEntryRowStatusTable
pppNcpBmcEntryRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of pppNcpBmcEntry components.

pppNcpBmcEntryRowStatusEntry.name: pppNcpBmcEntryRowStatusEntry
pppNcpBmcEntryRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single pppNcpBmcEntry component.

pppNcpBmcEntryRowStatus.name: pppNcpBmcEntryRowStatus
pppNcpBmcEntryRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of pppNcpBmcEntry components. These components can be added.

pppNcpBmcEntryComponentName.name: pppNcpBmcEntryComponentName
pppNcpBmcEntryComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

pppNcpBmcEntryStorageType.name: pppNcpBmcEntryStorageType
pppNcpBmcEntryStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the pppNcpBmcEntry tables.

pppNcpBmcEntryMacTypeIndex.name: pppNcpBmcEntryMacTypeIndex
pppNcpBmcEntryMacTypeIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the pppNcpBmcEntry tables.

pppNcpBmcEntryProvTable.name: pppNcpBmcEntryProvTable
pppNcpBmcEntryProvTable.description: This group contains the attributes for one entry in the BridgeMediaConfigEntry table.

pppNcpBmcEntryLocalStatus.name: pppNcpBmcEntryLocalStatus
pppNcpBmcEntryLocalStatus.description: This attribute indicates whether the local Ppp bridging entity should accept packets of the protocol type identified by the instance value of this component. Setting this attribute to accept allows packets of this protocol type to be accepted. A change to this attribute will not take effect until Ppp is restarted (lock/unlock).

pppNcpBmEntryRowStatusTable.name: pppNcpBmEntryRowStatusTable
pppNcpBmEntryRowStatusTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** This entry controls the addition and deletion of pppNcpBmEntry components.

pppNcpBmEntryRowStatusEntry.name: pppNcpBmEntryRowStatusEntry
pppNcpBmEntryRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single pppNcpBmEntry component.

pppNcpBmEntryRowStatus.name: pppNcpBmEntryRowStatus
pppNcpBmEntryRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of pppNcpBmEntry components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

pppNcpBmEntryComponentName.name: pppNcpBmEntryComponentName
pppNcpBmEntryComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

pppNcpBmEntryStorageType.name: pppNcpBmEntryStorageType
pppNcpBmEntryStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the pppNcpBmEntry tables.

pppNcpBmEntryMacTypeIndex.name: pppNcpBmEntryMacTypeIndex
pppNcpBmEntryMacTypeIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the pppNcpBmEntry tables.

pppNcpBmEntryOperTable.name: pppNcpBmEntryOperTable
pppNcpBmEntryOperTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** This group contains the attributes for one entry in the BridgeMediaEntry table.

pppNcpBmEntryLocalStatus.name: pppNcpBmEntryLocalStatus
pppNcpBmEntryLocalStatus.description: This attribute indicates whether the local Ppp bridging entity will accept packets of the protocol type identified by the instance value of this component. A value of accept indicates that packets of this protocol type will be accepted. A value of dontAccept indicates that packets of this type will not be accepted.

pppNcpBmEntryRemoteStatus.name: pppNcpBmEntryRemoteStatus
pppNcpBmEntryRemoteStatus.description: This attribute indicates whether the remote Ppp bridging entity will accept packets of the protocol type identified by the instance value of this component. A value of accept indicates that packets of this protocol type will be accepted. A value of dontAccept indicates that packets of this type will not be accepted.

pppFramerRowStatusTable.name: pppFramerRowStatusTable
pppFramerRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of pppFramer components.

pppFramerRowStatusEntry.name: pppFramerRowStatusEntry
pppFramerRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single pppFramer component.

pppFramerRowStatus.name: pppFramerRowStatus
pppFramerRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of pppFramer components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

pppFramerComponentName.name: pppFramerComponentName
pppFramerComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

pppFramerStorageType.name: pppFramerStorageType
pppFramerStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the pppFramer tables.

pppFramerIndex.name: pppFramerIndex
pppFramerIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the pppFramer tables.

pppFramerProvTable.name: pppFramerProvTable
pppFramerProvTable.description: This group contains the base provisioning data for the Framer component. Application or hardware interface specific provisioning data is contained in other provisionable Framer groups.

pppFramerInterfaceName.name: pppFramerInterfaceName
pppFramerInterfaceName.description: This attribute contains a hardware component name. The attribute associates the application with a specific link. This defines the logical processor on which Framer's parent component (as well as Framer itself) will run.

pppFramerStateTable.name: pppFramerStateTable
pppFramerStateTable.description: This group contains the three OSI State attributes. The descriptions generically indicate what each state attribute implies about the component. Note that not all the values and state combinations described here are supported by every component which uses this group. For component-specific information and the valid state combinations, refer to NTP 241-7001-150, Passport Operations and Maintenance Guide.

pppFramerAdminState.name: pppFramerAdminState
pppFramerAdminState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Administrative State of the component. The value locked indicates that the component is administratively prohibited from providing services for its users. A Lock or Lock - force command has been previously issued for this component. When the value is locked, the value of usageState must be idle. The value shuttingDown indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide service to its existing users only. A Lock command was issued against the component and it is in the process of shutting down. The value unlocked indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide services for its users. To enter this state, issue an Unlock command to this component.

pppFramerOperationalState.name: pppFramerOperationalState
pppFramerOperationalState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Operational State of the component. The value enabled indicates that the component is available for operation. Note that if adminState is locked, it would still not be providing service. The value disabled indicates that the component is not available for operation. For example, something is wrong with the component itself, or with another component on which this one depends. If the value is disabled, the usageState must be idle.

pppFramerUsageState.name: pppFramerUsageState
pppFramerUsageState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Usage State of the component. The value idle indicates that the component is not currently in use. The value active indicates that the component is in use and has spare capacity to provide for additional users. The value busy indicates that the component is in use and has no spare operating capacity for additional users at this time.

pppFramerStatsTable.name: pppFramerStatsTable
pppFramerStatsTable.description: This group contains the operational statistics data for a Framer component.

pppFramerFrmToIf.name: pppFramerFrmToIf
pppFramerFrmToIf.description: This attribute counts the number of frames transmitted to the link interface by Framer. Note: This does not include the number of frames transmitted directly to the hardware queue, thus bypassing the Framer component.

pppFramerFrmFromIf.name: pppFramerFrmFromIf
pppFramerFrmFromIf.description: This attribute counts the number of frames received from the link interface by Framer.

pppFramerAborts.name: pppFramerAborts
pppFramerAborts.description: This attribute counts the total number of aborts received.

pppFramerCrcErrors.name: pppFramerCrcErrors
pppFramerCrcErrors.description: This attribute counts the total number of frames with CRC errors.

pppFramerLrcErrors.name: pppFramerLrcErrors
pppFramerLrcErrors.description: This attribute counts the total number of frames with LRC errors.

pppFramerNonOctetErrors.name: pppFramerNonOctetErrors
pppFramerNonOctetErrors.description: This attribute counts the total number of frames that were non octet aligned.

pppFramerOverruns.name: pppFramerOverruns
pppFramerOverruns.description: This attribute counts the total number of frames received from the link for which overruns occurred.

pppFramerUnderruns.name: pppFramerUnderruns
pppFramerUnderruns.description: This attribute counts the total number of frames transmitted to the link for which underruns occurred.

pppFramerLargeFrmErrors.name: pppFramerLargeFrmErrors
pppFramerLargeFrmErrors.description: This attribute counts the total number of frames received which were too large. The frame execeeded the maximumFrameLengthLimit provisioned attribute or it contained more than the 255 block hardware limit.

pppFramerUtilTable.name: pppFramerUtilTable
pppFramerUtilTable.description: This group contains the link utilizaiton operational data for a Framer component.

pppFramerNormPrioLinkUtilToIf.name: pppFramerNormPrioLinkUtilToIf
pppFramerNormPrioLinkUtilToIf.description: This attribute is the utilization of the normal priority data sent to the link as a percentage of the available bandwidth on the link. The utilization is the average for the last minute.

pppFramerNormPrioLinkUtilFromIf.name: pppFramerNormPrioLinkUtilFromIf
pppFramerNormPrioLinkUtilFromIf.description: This attribute is the utilization of the normal priority data received from the link as a percentage of the available bandwidth on the link. The utilization is the average for the last minute.

pppLeqRowStatusTable.name: pppLeqRowStatusTable
pppLeqRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of pppLeq components.

pppLeqRowStatusEntry.name: pppLeqRowStatusEntry
pppLeqRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single pppLeq component.

pppLeqRowStatus.name: pppLeqRowStatus
pppLeqRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of pppLeq components. These components can be added and deleted.

pppLeqComponentName.name: pppLeqComponentName
pppLeqComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

pppLeqStorageType.name: pppLeqStorageType
pppLeqStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the pppLeq tables.

pppLeqIndex.name: pppLeqIndex
pppLeqIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the pppLeq tables.

pppLeqProvTable.name: pppLeqProvTable
pppLeqProvTable.description: This group contains the provisioned attributes for the LinkEmissionQueue component.

pppLeqMaxPackets.name: pppLeqMaxPackets
pppLeqMaxPackets.description: This attribute specifies the maximum number of packets allowed in the Leq before being discarded. If this attribute is set to zero then the maximum number of packets is calculated from the transmit data rate. This calculated value is placed in queuePktThreshold.

pppLeqMaxMsecData.name: pppLeqMaxMsecData
pppLeqMaxMsecData.description: This attribute specifies the maximum number of 'Milliseconds worth of data' allowed in the Leq before packets are discarded. The queueByteThreshold will be calculated from this attribute, based on the transmit data rate.

pppLeqMaxPercentMulticast.name: pppLeqMaxPercentMulticast
pppLeqMaxPercentMulticast.description: This attribute specifies the maximum percentage of multicast packets allowed in the Leq, based on queuePktThreshold, before being discarded. The calculated value will be placed in queueMulticastThreshold.

pppLeqTimeToLive.name: pppLeqTimeToLive
pppLeqTimeToLive.description: This attribute specifies the 'Milliseconds Time To Live' of packets in the Leq. If the timeToLive of a packet expires, it will be discarded.

pppLeqStatsTable.name: pppLeqStatsTable
pppLeqStatsTable.description: This group contains Link Emission Queue general statistics.

pppLeqTimedOutPkt.name: pppLeqTimedOutPkt
pppLeqTimedOutPkt.description: This attribute counts the number of packets that have been discarded due to exceeding the timeToLive. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

pppLeqHardwareForcedPkt.name: pppLeqHardwareForcedPkt
pppLeqHardwareForcedPkt.description: This attribute counts the number of hardware forced packets on this instance of Ppp. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

pppLeqForcedPktDiscards.name: pppLeqForcedPktDiscards
pppLeqForcedPktDiscards.description: This attribute counts the total number of hardware forced packets that had to be discarded due to link failure. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

pppLeqQueuePurgeDiscards.name: pppLeqQueuePurgeDiscards
pppLeqQueuePurgeDiscards.description: This attribute counts the total number of packets discarded by a queue purge (i.e. a discarding of all packets on the queue). This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

pppLeqTStatsTable.name: pppLeqTStatsTable
pppLeqTStatsTable.description: This group contains Link Emission Queue total statistics.

pppLeqTotalPktHandled.name: pppLeqTotalPktHandled
pppLeqTotalPktHandled.description: This attribute counts the total number of packets handled by the Leq. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

pppLeqTotalPktForwarded.name: pppLeqTotalPktForwarded
pppLeqTotalPktForwarded.description: This attribute counts the total number of packets forwarded by the Leq. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

pppLeqTotalPktQueued.name: pppLeqTotalPktQueued
pppLeqTotalPktQueued.description: This attribute counts the total number of packets that required queuing by the Leq due to transmit congestion. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

pppLeqTotalMulticastPkt.name: pppLeqTotalMulticastPkt
pppLeqTotalMulticastPkt.description: This attribute counts the total number of multicast packets handled by this instance of Ppp. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

pppLeqTotalPktDiscards.name: pppLeqTotalPktDiscards
pppLeqTotalPktDiscards.description: This attribute counts the total number of packets that were discarded for this instance of Ppp. This is the sum of timedOutPkt, forcedPktDiscards, queuePurgeDiscards, pktThresholdExceeded, byteThresholdExceeded, mulThresholdExceeded, and memThresholdExceeded. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

pppLeqCStatsTable.name: pppLeqCStatsTable
pppLeqCStatsTable.description: This group contains Link Emission Queue current statistics.

pppLeqCurrentPktQueued.name: pppLeqCurrentPktQueued
pppLeqCurrentPktQueued.description: This attribute counts the current number of packets queued.

pppLeqCurrentBytesQueued.name: pppLeqCurrentBytesQueued
pppLeqCurrentBytesQueued.description: This attribute counts the current number of bytes queued.

pppLeqCurrentMulticastQueued.name: pppLeqCurrentMulticastQueued
pppLeqCurrentMulticastQueued.description: This attribute counts the current number of multicast packets in the queue.

pppLeqThrStatsTable.name: pppLeqThrStatsTable
pppLeqThrStatsTable.description: This group contains Link Emission Queue threshold statistics.

pppLeqQueuePktThreshold.name: pppLeqQueuePktThreshold
pppLeqQueuePktThreshold.description: This attribute is the maximum number of packets that can be contained in the queue before being discarded. If maxPackets was set to 0 then this attribute will contain the value that has been calculated based on the transmit data rate. If maxPackets was set to one or more than this attribute will contain that number.

pppLeqPktThresholdExceeded.name: pppLeqPktThresholdExceeded
pppLeqPktThresholdExceeded.description: This attribute counts the number of packets discarded due to the queuePktThreshold being exceeded. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

pppLeqQueueByteThreshold.name: pppLeqQueueByteThreshold
pppLeqQueueByteThreshold.description: This attribute is the maximum number of bytes allowed in the queue based on maxMsecData and the transmit data rate.

pppLeqByteThresholdExceeded.name: pppLeqByteThresholdExceeded
pppLeqByteThresholdExceeded.description: This attribute counts the number of packets discarded due to the queueByteThreshold being exceeded. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

pppLeqQueueMulticastThreshold.name: pppLeqQueueMulticastThreshold
pppLeqQueueMulticastThreshold.description: This attribute is the number of multicast packets allowed in the queue based on maxPercentMulticast and maxPackets.

pppLeqMulThresholdExceeded.name: pppLeqMulThresholdExceeded
pppLeqMulThresholdExceeded.description: This attribute counts the number of packets discarded due to the queueMulticastThreshold being exceeded. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

pppLeqMemThresholdExceeded.name: pppLeqMemThresholdExceeded
pppLeqMemThresholdExceeded.description: This attribute counts the number of packets discarded due to exceeding the memory usage threshold for Leq. The memory usage threshold is determined by the Leq software, guaranteeing that the Leq does not consume all of the memory. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.
